intro: Gonolobus absalonensis, commonly known as the African morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple, often opening in the morning. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it thrives in well-drained soils with full sun exposure. Botanically, it is part of the Convolvulaceae family, known for its climbing or trailing growth habits.
